item.title: How NPR keeps reporting on the Pentagon after being barred from the building
item.description: NPR's Tom Bowman says his decades of roaming Pentagon halls ended after NPR refused to sign a new policy requiring reporters to wait for official information releases - but his reporting hasn't slowed at all.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Tom Bowman says his decades of roaming Pentagon halls ended after NPR refused to sign a new policy requiring reporters to wait for official information releases - but his reporting hasn't slowed at all.

item.title: National parks fee-free calendar drops MLK Day, Juneteenth and adds Trump's birthday
item.description: The Trump administration, which has railed against what it describes as "woke" policies, removed MLK Day and Juneteenth from next year's list of fare-exempt days for visitors at dozens of national parks.

item.title: What to know about Admiral Bradley, who oversaw controversial boat strikes

item.title: The immigration crackdown in Charlotte seems to be over, but the community is struggling
item.description: The Border Patrol's aggressive immigration operation in Charlotte, N.C., took the city by surprise. It lasted about a week, but immigrants and other residents say their city won't ever be the same.

item.title: Appeals court hands Trump a victory, OK'ing firings of two independent agency heads
item.description: The D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals ruled 2 to 1 that President Trump's firings of Democratic members of the Merit Systems Protection Board and the National Labor Relations Board were lawful.
